nodes.bodyText: We have an existing module that would be a better fit: core-java-modules/core-java-arrays-operations-advanced
I have moved the code into there.

Obviously we won't need a pom.xml since we're going to move the code to an existing module. We should also use assertj if possible instead of hamcrest. The assertj assertions are fluent and thus easier to read.
When we move the code to the other module, we should also put all the tests in the same package as the Plane class.

When naming the tests, keep in mind what the different parts of the name mean. The "given" is for preconditions or saying what the input is. The "when" is for describing the behavior being tested. The "then" is to describe the expected result. Thus, an appropriate name for this method would be givenSameContents_whenDeepEquals_thenTrue. Rename the other tests according to this pattern as well.
Just use a single call: assertTrue(Arrays.deepEquals(planes1, planes2)
Again, no need to create a variable -- put the expression in the assertion
